results.title: A Walk in the forest
results.brief_description: Based on an incident which occurred during oil exploration in Papua New Guinea. Two Australian geologists were working in an unknown area. After an argument with an old native woman, Boro, one of the natives on the survey fell sick with pneumonia. He believed she had put a curse on him. He had to be taken out of the jungle, by foot, canoe and eventually aircraft, and taken to hospital 300 miles away in Port Moresby.

results.title: A Walk in space
results.brief_description: The remarkable record of astronaut Edward White’s space walk from the Gemini IV space capsule. The films shows the earth one hundred miles below the ship and White’s manoeuvres while travelling 17,500 per hour outside the capsule.
results.description: The remarkable record of astronaut Edward White’s space walk from the Gemini IV space capsule. The films shows the earth one hundred miles below the ship and White’s manoeuvres while travelling 17,500 per hour outside the capsule.

results.title: A Vous la France! [text]
results.creator_credit: Brian Page and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Book to accompany videos. The course is an introduction to simple everyday French. The book contains the texts of all the conversations and interviews together with language notes, background information, quizzes, exercises and a handy reference section. It can be used on its own or in conjunction with the videos. Audio cassettes are also available.

results.title: A Vous la France! [kit]
results.brief_description: Two audio cassettes, Notes for teachers and a workbook to accompany the videorecorded course in French, A vous la France! Together they provide more structured reinforcement of the vocabulary introduced in the programs. The script of the programs is presented in the workbook with exercises and the Teacher’s notes give suggestions as to how best use the materials. The audio-cassettes give examples of correct pronunciation with opportunity to practise at intervals.

results.title: A Voice in the city
results.creator_credit: Morten Parker and Parker Film Associates
results.brief_description: Describes the routine daily activities of a union representative member of a District Council in New York City, who looks after the interests of a number of legal municipal unions. Throughout a typically busy week, she mediates on behalf of one local union, settles the grievance of another and recruits members for a new maintenance workers union. Illustrates the important role of the labour union in a democratic society and the many satisfaction’s it offers those who work within it.

results.title: A Visual heritage
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, CBS, Coast Community Colleges, Holt, Rinehart and Winston and KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Traces the highlights of the history of photography. Includes the pioneering work of Louis Daguerre and Nicephore Niepce which enabled the world to see itself objectively for the first time. This program features a number of historical photographs and a discussion of early photography by experts in the field.

results.title: A Visual dictionary
results.creator_credit: Sheldon Renan, David Adams and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Film Terms”.
Illustrates basic filmmaking language as it is used in the writing, shooting, and editing of a motion picture. Defines and demonstrates script terminology, kinds of shots, lenses and their effects, camera angles and movement, sound, and optical effects. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary/teacher levels.

results.title: A Visit to puppets
results.brief_description: The Baj Teatr, Warsaw, is one of nineteen Polish puppet theatres for children. Everything at the Baj has a professional appearance - the finely constructed puppets, sets, beautiful costumes - all made by the theatre’s staff of artists and actors. A short play is presented, using puppets seen in construction earlier in the film. Commentary spoken by Lucie Gray.

results.title: A Visit to Ireland
results.creator_credit: David A. Smart and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: The film shows various aspects of life in Southern Ireland. Covers the following: typical farm activities, harvesting grain, thatching with straw, peat cutting; scenes of Blarney Castle and of the Blarney Stone; life in Dublin; carding, spinning and weaving in the home; the churches of Ireland; recreational activities.

results.title: A Visit from St Nicholas: a Coronet fantasy
results.creator_credit: David A. Smart and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Animated adaptation of “Twas the night before Christmas” by Clement Clarke Moore executed in a simple limited animation style including 3-D objects and cut-out animation techniques.
